tourName: Classic Madagascar discovery tour, tailor made
generalInfo:
Madagascar Classic Tour: Discovery tour that includes the best of what Madagascar has to offer in two weeks. You will have a personal driver and as we offer tailor-made programmes therefore you could change few details of the tour to suit your preferences. This can be done so easy because the holidays being pesonalised esspecially for you! Madagascar is well known for its wildlife therefore you will be discovering magnificient flora and fauna. On your visit you will be spotting many different species of lemurs and exploring biodiversity rich national parks in South, West & East. Trekking through breath taking varied sceneries, spotting nocturnal animals in the night walks. As well as enjoying the beautiful beaches. You will have your own personal chauffeur guide with car, so you can experience Madagascar at your own pace


Highlights of the tour

- Spotting lemurs
- Close encounter with Ring Tail lemurs in Anja
- Endemic bird wacthing Zombitse National Park
- Hiking in Isalo National Park canyons with picnic made by local chef
- Spotting Golden Bamboo lemurs in Ranomafana
- Sunset walk in Avenue of Baobabs
- Wine tasting in Fianarantsoa
- Singing Indri Indri Andasibe Mantadia National Park
- Lounging in the golden sandy beaches
- Sundowner in Antananarivo

dayInfo.description: Antananarivo: ‘’Manao ahoana’’ & ‘’Salama’’ Welcome to nature’s sanctuary. You will be welcomed & greeted by your guide or representative on arrival Antananarivo Ivato International Airport. You will be transferred to your hotel.

Andasibe: After breakfast you will travel to Andasibe. Travel time is about 3 hours. In the evening around 6pm you will be guided through the Mitsinjo Forest on Night Walk to spot the nocturnal animals including ‘Goodman Mouse lemur. Experience the rainforest after dark where nocturnal lemurs, chameleons, geckos, frogs and fireflies come alive. The night walk can take 1½ – 2 hours.

Andasibe: After breakfast you will visit the Andasibe-Mantadia National Park Special Reserve Analamazaotra to spot and hear the sounds of Indri Indri Lemurs. The Indri is the largest living lemurs and known as babakotos in the local Malagasy language, which means ‘man of the forest’ or ‘little father’ and unlike other lemurs, only have a short stumpy tail. Indris produce loud territorial calls that can be heard from over 1km away as you enter the park.

Antsirabe: After breakfast you will travel to Antsirabe along the one of the scenic routes in the central highlands. Antsirabe is the third largest city in Madagascar situated in the high altitude (about 1 500 m). The cool temperatures are in the high altitude the reason why the Norwegian Missionaries chose this city in 1872. Antsirabe is the home of one of the award winning best beers in Madagascar THB (Three Horses Beer). This compact city centre with its nice mixed architecture of different styles invite visitors for a walk. In the European district French cottage-style houses are built next to Scandinavian villas with English style gardens. The tree-lined avenues always give some freshness whenever the sun is too bright. It best takes the pousse-pousse rickshaws to see this beautiful city.
Ranomafana: After breakfast you will travel to Ranomafana National Park. Along the way there are many view points and villages to stop discover.

Ranomafana: After breakfast you have full day to explore this wonderful rainforest. Ranomafana is a conservation success story in terms of many ways. Today Ranomafana plays crucial role in education and scientific research with help of Centre Valbio Research Centre. Ranomafana National Park success is because of one woman vision and dedication to preserve the nature and wildlife. Dr. Patricia Wright is considered to be one of the world’s foremost experts on lemurs, Wright is best known for her 26-year study of social and family interactions of wild lemurs in Ranomafana National Park, Madagascar. There are several animal species have been recorded, 12 species of lemurs, including golden bamboo lemur, greater bamboo lemur, Milne-Edward’s shifaka, red bellied lemur etc, 115 species of birds. About thirty among them exist exclusively in the primary forest of the park. As well 90 species of butterflies, 98 species of amphibian and 62 species of reptiles; chameleons, lizards and fish. In the evening if you like you can do the night walk along the park road to spot nocturnal animals.

Ambalavao: You will continue your journey to Ambalavao. Ambalavao is a fascinating little town in the central highlands south of Fianarantsoa. The town is known for its paper-making, silk making and wines. Here you will have an opportunity to enjoy the tastes of Madagascar wines. You can also buy some to take home as souvenirs. The striking feature of this town is the architecture. The old town houses with wooden balconies. From the centre of the market you can get a good view of the town houses and the church.

Anja Community Reserve: After early breakfast you will travel to Anja(Anjaha) Community reserve. Anja Park is a great place to see ring tailed lemurs in the troops. It is community run initiative to protect the lemurs. The landscape is incredible with the back drop of granite rocks. You will take 2 hours walk around the reserve to see the ring tailed lemurs families and varieties of flora. You can also see some Bestsileo tombs. Later you will travel to Isalo National Park

Isalo: Isalo National Park is the Grand Canyon of Madagascar. Kingdom of Queen of the Isalo, cradle of a particular wild nature and an exceptional landscape, the lovers of the big escapes will be seduced by this park. It appeal is the remarkable landscape of the Jurassic Era eroded ruiniform sandstone, canyons and rare plants as well as the wildlife. Full day trekking of Isalo, there are several circuits and you can talk to the guide for the best option that suits your expectation. Most hiking circuits include the natural swimming pool. It’s really worth a dip in the natural swimming pool. These are 77 species of birds live in Isalo among which the Benson rock-thrush Pseudocossyphus bensoni, an endemic species of Madagascar that is well protected. You can also find 14 species of nocturnal lemurs, as well as ring-tailed, Verreaux’s Shifakas and red-fronted brown lemurs. In the late afternoon if time permits, you visit the Window of Isalo to see the sunset for a spectacular view.

Ifaty: After breakfast you will travel to Ifaty. Rest of the day at leisure. Many optional activities can be arranged according to your interests. (Arboretum d'Antsokay, Trecking to the nearby forests of baobab trees and mangroves, a paradise for ornithologists.)
Ifaty: Full day at leisure
Antananarivo: After breakfast you will travel to Tulear to take flight to Antananarivo. If time permits you can explore the city.
Antananarivo: Today you will fly back home or to the next destination

generalInfo:
Madagascar is a land of extraordinary beauty and diversity, offering a journey unlike any other. With its unique combination of vibrant wildlife, stunning landscapes, and rich cultural heritage, the island promises an unforgettable adventure. Known for its endemic species, including the iconic Indri Indri and the elusive Aye-Aye lemur, Madagascar is a haven for nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts. The lush rainforests, beautiful lakes, and the tranquil Pangalanes Channel provide the perfect backdrop for encounters with some of the rarest creatures on Earth.

The island’s landscapes are as varied as its wildlife. From the rainforests of Andasibe to the shores of Lake Ampitabe, each destination reveals a different side of Madagascar’s natural beauty. The Pangalanes Channel, a series of waterways connecting villages and sanctuaries, offers peaceful boat rides in the heart of Madagascar’s environment. Ankanin’ny Nofy is a sanctuary of calm, where visitors can explore the Palmarium reserve, swim in pristine waters, or simply relax amid lush greenery.

Cultural exploration is equally rewarding, with Madagascar’s history coming alive at sites like Ambohimanga, the sacred birthplace of the Merina monarchy. The bustling town of Toamasina showcases a lively blend of markets, rickshaws, and colonial architecture, reflecting the island’s heritage. Combined with the warmth and hospitality of the Malagasy people, these experiences offer an insight into the island’s traditions and way of life.

Madagascar is not just a destination but a journey into a world that feels untouched and timeless. Whether trekking through rainforests, cruising along the Pangalanes, or savoring fresh seafood by the lake, every moment is filled with the magic of this extraordinary island. This adventure offers a profound appreciation for one of the most unique places on Earth.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Antananarivo: Welcome, Tonga soa! Upon your arrival at Ivato International Airport, you will be met and transferred to your hotel. If time permits, you will be provided with a comprehensive briefing about your adventure. Distance 30-45 mins

Antananarivo – Andasibe - Discovery of Reptiles: After breakfast, you will depart for Andasibe, with a stop en route to visit an exotic farm showcasing a variety of reptiles, amphibians, and mammals. Following the visit, the journey continues to Andasibe. In the evening, a night walk is highly recommended, as the park is home to several nocturnal species, including the long-eared owl, which may be spotted resting on tree branches, mouse lemurs and other reptiles. Distance: 145km by car

Indri Indri, the Star of the Day: Early this morning, you will depart for the Analamazaotra Special Reserve, where the day will be dedicated to exploring the rich Malagasy fauna and flora. Analamazaotra Park is renowned for its rare orchids, which bloom throughout the forest, playing a vital role in maintaining the ecosystem's balance and providing shelter for a diverse range of animals, including the Indri indri, which can be observed year-round. The reserve is also home to numerous bird species, such as the Blue Coua and the white-throated rail. In the afternoon, you will visit a private reserve and explore Lemur Island.

Andasibe – Manambato – Ankanin'ny Nofy: After breakfast, you’ll set off for Manambato, the gateway to Ankanin’ny Nofy. From there, enjoy a scenic boat ride across the serene Rasoa Be Lake and along the Pangalanes Channel, arriving at the enchanting Ankanin’ny Nofy. Upon arrival, you’ll check into your hotel and settle in. In the evening, embark on an exciting nocturnal excursion to spot the elusive and fascinating “Aye-aye” lemur. Distance: 140km by car Cruise: 3 hours

Ankanin’ny Nofy - A sanctuary of nature: Today, you’ll explore the private reserve of 'Le Palmarium', nestled on a stunning 50-hectare peninsula. This remarkable sanctuary feels like a curated 'personal collection', where diverse species of plants and animals have been lovingly gathered and meticulously cared for. Highlights include a rich variety of palms, unique xerophytic plants, vibrant yellow-flowered acacias, and striking lianas. The afternoon is yours to enjoy at leisure. You can stroll along the scenic banks of the channel, take a refreshing swim, or immerse yourself in the charm of nearby villages. Visit: 2 hours

Day at leisure in the natural sanctuary: This day is set aside for relaxation at the Palmarium. Spend the morning by the calm shores of Lake Ampitabe, enjoying the quiet views and fresh breeze. Wander among the palm trees and gardens and take some time to rest in the shade, listening to the sounds of nature. In the evening, gather back at the lodge for a delicious seafood meal, prepared with fresh, local ingredients.

Ankanin’ny Nofy – Toamasina – Cruise on the Pangalanes Channel: In the early morning, you’ll embark on a boat transfer to Toamasina. The Pangalanes Channel, operational since the early 20th century, has long served as a vital trade route, connecting Madagascar’s eastern coast to the bustling port of Toamasina. Known as the country’s primary commercial harbor, Toamasina boasts charming rickshaws and wide, palm-lined avenues. Upon your arrival in Toamasina you will be picked up and transferred to your hotel. Cruise: 3 hours

Toamasina - Antananarivo - Back to the Capital: After days filled with discovery and relaxation, it’s time to journey back to Antananarivo. Depending on your flight schedule, you’ll be transferred to Toamasina Airport for a short domestic flight to Ivato International Airport, lasting approximately one hour. Upon arrival in Antananarivo, you’ll be escorted to your hotel to settle in and relax. Flight duration: About 1 hour

Antananarivo: Visit of Ambohimanga: After breakfast, set off on a city tour to explore the historic architecture, starting from the top of the town with breathtaking views and iconic administrative buildings. Next, journey to Ambohimanga, the birthplace of the Merina monarchy, where Madagascar’s rich history will come to life. Afterwards, return to the hotel to unwind. Tour duration: About 1 hour

International departure: Veloma! As your memorable journey through Madagascar comes to an end, filled with unforgettable experiences and treasured photographs, it’s time to return home. Depending on your flight schedule, you’ll be transferred to Ivato International Airport for departure. Wishing you a safe and pleasant flight home!

tourName: Family wildlife luxury tour in Madagascar
generalInfo:
Our Family Wildlife Tour in Madagascar invites you and your loved ones on an unforgettable 11-day adventure through the spectacular and diverse corners of this fascinating country. Encounter adorable lemurs, search for rare and endemic wildlife, immerse yourself in captivating cultural traditions, and marvel at natural wonders – all while staying in luxurious, family-friendly lodges and camps.

Your journey begins with a night in Antananarivo (known locally as 'Tana'), where you can unwind after your flight by relaxing at your hotel pool or exploring the city’s intriguing architecture.

From there, you’ll travel east by car for a couple of hours to Andasibe-Mantadia National Park, a protected rainforest brimming with wildlife. Here, you’ll find lemurs, including the indri – the largest lemur species in the world. Enjoy thrilling night walks to spot nocturnal creatures and family picnics by breathtaking waterfalls.

After a return night in Tana to break up the journey, you’ll fly three hours west to Morondava, situated along the Mozambique Channel. Spend two nights in this culturally rich area, famed for its elaborately carved wooden royal tombs.

You’ll visit the Avenue of the Baobabs, a chance to capture Madagascar’s most iconic landscape, and explore the Kirindy Reserve, renowned as the best place in the country to spot the elusive fossa – Madagascar’s largest carnivorous mammal. This reserve also boasts three of the island’s seven species of baobabs.

Following another stopover in Tana to connect the two regions, you’ll fly northwest to Anjajavy for a three-night stay at the luxurious Anjajavy Lodge. This idyllic retreat is home to a rich variety of lemurs, making it far more than a typical beach destination – it’s a paradise for wildlife enthusiasts.

With sumptuous family suites and activities designed to delight both children and adults, this enriching Family Wildlife Tour in Madagascar promises to be an unforgettable experience that you’ll cherish for years to come.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Antananarivo - You’ll fly into Ivato International Airport in Antananarivo, where you’ll be greeted by an guide who will drive you to your hotel in Antananarivo, locally known as ‘Tana’. Take a dip in the pool and enjoy the lovely views over the city, or head out to explore the traditional architecture and distinct Indonesian influence of Tana.

Transfer to Andasibe-Mantadia National Park - After breakfast, your guide who will take you east to Andasibe-Mantadia National Park, a spectacular rainforest park. The park consists of two protected areas; the Perinet Special Reserve and Mantadia National Park, known for their population of indri lemurs, the largest living lemur species. The journey to Andasibe offers first time visitors to Madagascar a unique insight into rural life with rice fields, redbrick houses and roadside stalls selling seasonal fruits and vegetables on the sides of the roads. You'll arrive at your lodge where you’ll stay at the lodge on a full-board basis for two nights. This afternoon, visit a private reserve run by local NGO Mitsinjo. The NGO funds reforestation, community education and sensitization to conservation issues including running Madagascar’s first amphibian captive-breeding facility. Here you will see a large variation of wildlife and you can also plant an indigenous species along the reforestation trail.

Exploring Mantadia National Park - Following a delicious breakfast, you’ll drive to Mantadia National Park for a day of adventure and for a picnic lunch. Look out for lemurs in this incredible park including the indri lemur, diademed sifaka, grey bamboo lemur, red-bellied lemur and white ruffed lemur. Here the trails are slightly more difficult, but we recommend it as the forest is taller, wilder and less crowded than Perinet. It’s a naturalist's heaven with many rare species of mammals, reptiles and birds, and an abundance of birds including the scaly ground roller, pitta-like ground roller and breasted coua. At the Rianasoa Waterfall enjoy a delicious picnic before hiking back to the vehicle and returning to the lodge. For those who wish, you can head out on a night walk with a local guide this evening to explore the forest surrounding the reserve. You’ll be able to see a variety of nocturnal lemurs including mouse lemurs, white footed sportive lemur, fat-tailed dwarf lemur, and the woolly lemur.

Exploring Perinet Reserve and transfer to Antananarivo - Wake up and enjoy an early breakfast before meeting your guide and head out to the 180-hectare Perinet Reserve to find the indri lemur. With a barely visible tail, black and white markings and a surprised teddy bear face, this lemur is one of the few animals in the world that cannot survive in captivity. Whilst walking through the rainforest, there are 11 species of lemur to spot and you may also find a troop of grey bamboo lemurs, common brown lemur, diademed sifaka and the black and white ruffed lemur. Following lunch in Andasibe, you’ll drive back to Antananarivo and check in to your hotel for the night.

Fly to Morondava, Avenue of Baobabs - After breakfast at Maison Gallieni, you will be taken to the airport for your 3 hour flight west to Morondava. Morondava is located in the west of Madagascar, on the delta of the river of the same name at the edge of the Mozambique Channel. Morondava was the centre of the Sakalava kingdom and is known for its beautifully sculpted wooden royal tombs. Upon arrival at the airport, you will be greeted by your guide and be transferred to your hotel, where you stay for two nights on a full board basis. The afternoon is at your leisure or you can choose to have a tour around Morondava. In the evening, you will be driven about 20km to the Avenue of the Baobabs for a beautiful sunset and fantastic photo opportunities. This is the most iconic view of Madagascar.

Visit Morondava & Kirindy Private Reserve - Today you will have an early breakfast and will be driven to the north-east of Morondava to the Kirindy Reserve. Krindy Reserve is privately managed forest that is known as the best place in Madagascar to see the elusive fossa. It is also home to the Madagascar Giant Jumping Rat, endemic to this forest, and 8 lemur species including Madame Berthe’s mouse lemur. The landscape is dry deciduous forest interspersed with towering baobab trees. Three out of the island’s seven baobab species are found here. After a leisurely picnic lunch, you will be driven back to Morondava to your hotel.

Fly back to Tana - Today, your guide will transfer you to the airport for your flight back to Tana. Upon arriving in Tana, you will be greeted by another guide who will transfer you to your hotel, where you stay for one night on a half board basis.

Fly to Anjajavy Private Reserve - Wake up bright and early and enjoy breakfast, after you will be driven back to Ivato Airport for your scheduled charter North-west to Anjajavy. Upon arrival you will be greeted by a hotel staff member and transferred to Anjajavy Le Lodge where you will stay for the next three nights on a full board basis in a Seaview Villa. Anjajavy Lodge is located within a 450 hectare nature reserve on Madagascar’s north-west coast. The lodge’s 25 duplex, rosewood villas all have private decks overlooking the ocean. Meals can be served in an enclosed oasis in the hotel grounds or on the beach. The surrounding forest is alive with lemurs, chameleons, malachite kingfishers and hummingbirds. At 5:30 pm you will depart for a night walk in the reserve to spot a variety of nocturnal lemurs. While the reserve’s show-stoppers are undoubtedly the charismatic coquerel’s sifakas, the hours of darkness also have their star performers. Weighing a mere 63 grams, danfoss mouse lemurs scamper about in the shrubbery around the reserve just after nightfall, springing from branch to branch, quick as a flash, in search of food. If you hear a strange squeal coming from the tree tops, then you have probably found a Grewcock’s sportive lemur. Other mammals to spot are the endemic tsingy tuft-tailed rat, Commerson’s leaf-nosed bat, or Madagascar’s largest predator - the rare and elusive fossa.

Explore Anjajavy - This morning, set out for a walk along the ‘Chemin des Crabes’ to see the fabulous birdlife, beautiful baobabs and of course, the famous hairy crab. Anjajavy is one of the best destinations to spot the regal Madagascar fish eagle, shy crested Ibis, or rare Madagascar sacred Ibis. At the end of the walk, you will visit a small cave where you will find a fossilized lemur skull, stalactites and sharks’ teeth. You will return to the lodge for lunch and a leisurely afternoon.

Explore the tsingy rock formations - You will enjoy a long walk this morning along the Giant’s Causeway and King’s Alley. Visit the extremely ancient baobab trees, tsingy rock formations found only in Madagascar, as well as a variety of lemurs including the Coquerel’s sifakas. The sifakas, along with troops of common brown lemurs, roam freely in the gardens and surrounding reserves. You will head back to the lodge for lunch and a relaxing afternoon.

Departure from Madagascar - Sadly your holiday has come to an end, you will be transferred to the airstrip for your morning flight to Tana by scheduled charter. Arriving back at Tana airport, you will be met by a travel representative, who will help you in checking in for your outbound flight. This brings your stunning Family Wildlife Adventure to an end, but with memories that will last a lifetime.

generalInfo:
Discover the best of Madagascar on this 17-day journey through the country’s top national parks and stunning landscapes.

This itinerary is perfect for those seeking to experience Madagascar’s incredible diversity of landscapes, wildlife, and culture. Spot indri lemurs in the Perinet Reserve, find chameleons in the Coastal Rainforest, and marvel at the tsingy rock formations and iconic baobabs unique to this enchanting island.

Your adventure begins east of Antananarivo in Andasibe-Mantadia National Park. This protected rainforest park features stunning hiking trails, cascading waterfalls, and a wide variety of lemur species, including the indri, the largest lemur in the world.

Next, travel to Isalo National Park, renowned for its dramatic landscapes, including fascinating rock formations, tranquil natural pools, and vast canyons that serve as sacred burial sites for the Bara people.

Continue to Zombitse National Park, a haven for bird enthusiasts and home to the Appert’s greenbul, one of Madagascar’s rarest endemic bird species.

Finally, fly north to Nosy Be and take a boat to the exclusive Nosy Komba island. This former volcanic island, now blanketed in lush forest and encircled by sapphire waters, offers opportunities for diving, snorkelling, inland tours, quad biking, and fishing in a pristine paradise.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Antananarivo - On arrival in Ivato International Airport in Antananarivo, you’ll be greeted by an English-speaking guide who will accompany you to your hotel in the upper town of Antananarivo. Head out to explore the traditional architecture and distinct Indonesian influence of Antananarivo, locally known as ‘Tana’.

Transfer to Andasibe-Mantadia National Park - After breakfast, you’ll meet your guide and begin the four-hour drive east to Andasibe-Mantadia National Park. It is a beautiful rainforest park with two protected areas including the Perinet Special Reserve and Mantadia National Park. The Perinet Reserve is famous for its population of indri lemurs, the largest living lemur species on earth. The drive to Andasibe offers a great introduction to rural life in Madagascar, with rice fields, redbrick houses and roadside stalls selling seasonal fruits and vegetables along the route. You’ll arrive at your accommodation in time for lunch (you’ll stay at the lodge for two nights). This afternoon, visit a private reserve operated by local NGO Mitsinjo. The NGO funds reforestation, community education and sensitization to conservation issues as well as running Madagascar’s first amphibian captive-breeding facility. Here you will see a stunning array of wildlife and can also plant an indigenous species along the reforestation trail.

Exploring Andasibe-Mantadia National Park - After breakfast, you’ll meet your guide and drive to Mantadia National Park for a day of adventure. This stunning park is filled with lemur species including the indri lemur, grey bamboo lemur, red-bellied lemur, white ruffed lemur and diademed sifaka. It’s a naturalist's paradise with many rare species of mammals, reptiles and a variety of birds including the breasted coua, the scaly ground roller, the pitta-like ground roller. You’ll see a variety of nocturnal lemurs including the woolly lemur, mouse lemur, white footed sportive lemur and fat-tailed dwarf lemur.

Exploring Perinet Reserve and transfer to Antananarivo - After an early breakfast, you’ll meet your guide and head out to the Perinet Reserve, a 180-hectare expanse of wilderness, famous for its population of indri lemurs, known for their distinct black and white markings, a barely visible tail, and a surprised teddy bear face. Along with the indri, there are 11 other species of lemur to spot as you walk through the rainforest including the common brown lemur, black and white ruffed lemur, grey bamboo lemur and the diademed sifaka. Perinet Reserve is home to many reptiles, invertebrates, and some of Madagascar’s orchid species, and there’s an abundance of birds including the blue coua, velvet asity, Nuthatch vanga and many other endemic species. After lunch in Andasibe, you’ll be driven back to Tana, where you’ll check into your accommodation for the night.

Fly to Isalo National Park - After breakfast, your guide will drive you to Ivato Airport where you’ll board a domestic flight to Toliara. On arrival in Toliara airport, you’ll be greeted by your driver and English speaking guide, and begin your drive to Isalo National Park. You’ll check in to your hotel for the next two nights. Settle into your room or take a dip in the pool, where you can soak up the breathtaking views of Isalo National Park. The combination of sandstone rocks cut by deep canyons and eroded into spectacular shapes and rare endemic plants, makes Isalo one of Madagascar’s most appreciated parks.

Exploring Isalo National Park - After breakfast, you’ll head out on a full day of guided walking, exploring the vast plains and spectacular rock formations. Isalo National Park is one of Madagascar’s most diverse and fascinating parks. One of the best trails is the ‘Canyon des Singes’, which curves through the thick forest and brightly coloured rock formations to reach a magical rock pool called the ‘Piscine Naturelle’.

Exploring Zombitse National Park and transfer to Toliara - After breakfast, you’ll meet your guide and make the one-hour drive to Zombitse National Park, a richly biodiverse transition forest, spanning 36,300 hectares between the western and southern habitat types. It’s an excellent spot for birdwatchers, with the chance to spot the Appert’s greenbul, one of Madagascar’s rarest endemic species, found only in this forest. You’ll check in to your lodge for one night and spend the afternoon relaxing in your room, strolling along the beach or taking a deep in the dazzling waters of the Mozambique Channel.

Return to Tana - Today, fly back to Antananarivo, in order to continue your journey to the South of Madagascar. Upon arrival, a Wayfairer representative will meet you at the airport and transfer you to your nearby hotel.

Fly to Mandrare - After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport for your morning flight to Fort Dauphin. The flight takes around three hours and you’ll be met on arrival by a guide from your accommodation, who’ll drive you to a local restaurant for lunch in Fort Dauphin. After lunch, you’ll make the four-hour drive to Mandrare River Camp, where you can settle into your luxury accommodation and enjoy the stunning views over the Mandrare River. You stay here for three nights. In the evening, you’ll head out on a thrilling night walk in the Forest of Zenavo. You’ll get to see diurnal lemurs bedding down and nocturnal lemurs waking up as you walk through the ancient Sacred Spiny Forest. Keep your eyes peeled for sifakas, mouse lemurs and white-footed sportive lemurs - once the sun has set they'll become active, along with a variety of chameleons and birds.

Exploring Mandrare River Camp - Enjoy breakfast before venturing out to the beautiful Sacred Gallery Forest, located to the south of the camp. Take a boat across the Mandrare River to reach this spectacular forest, known for its inquisitive groups of ring-tailed lemurs and the entertaining Verreaux sifaka. You’ll return to the camp for lunch and a relaxing dip in the pool. In the evening, you’ll head out for a walk through the Sacred Spiny Forest, and an incredible number of flora and fauna that can only be found in this forest.

Sacred Spiny Forest & Cultural Dancing - Enjoy an early morning cup of tea or coffee before heading out for a sunrise walk through the Sacred Spiny Forest. It’s a magical experience to witness the sunlight cracking through the octopus trees, as the wildlife begin to wake up and become active. After your walk you’ll return to camp for a well-earned breakfast, followed by a visit to the local village or to the local market where you can browse beautiful handmade crafts. You’ll enjoy lunch at the camp and a relaxing afternoon watching life along the Mandrare River from the private terrace of your tent. In the evening, you’ll head out for sundowners among the baobabs, and you’ll have the wonderful experience of watching the sunset and moonrise over these ancient trees. In the evening, you may be treated to an incredible show of traditional dancing, singing and music, performed by the local village. Song and dance is at the heart of Antandroy culture and is used in all major rituals and life events.

Return to Tana - After your last breakfast at your accommodation, you will be driven to Fort Dauphin, in time for your Tsaradia flight back to Tana. Upon arrival you'll be greeted by a travel representative and transferred to your accommodation for one night.

Fly to Nosy Komba Island in Northern Madagascar - his morning you will be driven back to Ivato Airport in time for your 1.5 hour flight north to Nosy Be. Upon arrival, you will be welcomed by a Tsara Komba staff member and transferred to the lodge on Nosy Komba, a neighbouring island, just south of Nosy Be. The transfer is by road and boat, taking approximately one hour. You stay at Tsara Komba Lodge for three nights on a full board basis. It is a 4-star luxury hotel with a rare and authentic charm, in perfect keeping with nature and with the area’s outstanding biodiversity. It combines a stylish and exclusive atmosphere, an excellent slow food cuisine and tailored-made excursions, in an atmosphere dominated by a commitment to comfortable luxury and ecology. Experience the gentle caress of the wind, the bird songs and the sound of the waves lapping around this former volcano today covered by an abundant forest, bordered by a sapphire blue sea with excellent golden sandy beaches. The preservation of this sublime environment and the community-minded activities being pursued here to encourage harmonious sustainable development for the benefit of the local population are just two of the ethical aspects of this marvellous eco-paradise.

Explore Nosy Komba Island - Fill your days with your own selection of activities. The hotel can arrange customised excursions to neighbouring islands, nature reserves, for fishing, quad biking, tours around the island, scuba-diving or snorkelling. All these activities are just few minutes away from the hotel for you to admire and explore the sheer beauty of the ocean depths.

Fly back to Tana - This morning you will say goodbye to island living and be transferred by boat back to Nosy Be, in time for your 1.5 hour flight back to Tana. Upon arrival into Tana your guide will meet you and transfer you to Relais des Plataeux Hotel & Spa for your last night in Madagascar. The afternoon or evening can be spent at your leisure, perhaps doing some final souvenir shopping.

International flight home - Enjoy a final breakfast at Relais des Plateux before transferring to the Ivato International Airport for your international return flight home. Although your incredible Highlights of Madagascar holiday has come to an end, we’re sure you’ll leave with many special memories to look back on, and plenty of photos and stories to share back home.

generalInfo:
If you’re looking for an exotic location from where to enjoy your honeymoon, Madagascar is one such holiday treat that certainly ticks all the right boxes.

Discovering the north of the island lets you live amongst the rainforest where wildlife abounds and the slopes of the Amber Mountain provide ample stomping grounds for honeymooners looking for unique experiences, such as searching for tiny chameleons.

Hiking within the Ankarana Reserve is also a must for wildlife lovers with ring-tailed lemurs, exotic bird species and a whole host of reptiles scuttling over the limestone rock formations bound to excite and enthral in equal measures.

Andasibe National Park is another key area for animal action with a nocturnal guided walking presenting all manner of wide eyes peering from the undergrowth to accompany fascinating shrieks and calls in the dark.

Away from the wildlife watching, your honeymoon in Madagascar can also feature a spot of cultural sightseeing with the market places of Diego Suarez always worth a visit after spending time strolling arm and arm through the colonial cobbled streets.

The southern islands of Nosy Tanikely, Nosy Be and Nosy Saba provide a classic completion with opportunities to snorkel in a marine park, relax under shaded palms or visit a ylang-ylang flower distillery just some of the experiences to help you round off your Madagascar honeymoon in style.

Throughout this tailor made tour you’ll have a personal guide and driver who will transport you around the island at a pace that suits you.

dayInfo.description: Antananarivo: ‘’Manao ahoana’’ ‘’Tonga Soa’’ & ‘’Salama’’ Welcome to tropical paradise. You will be welcomed & greeted by your guide or representative on arrival Antananarivo Ivato International Airport. You will travel to your hotel. Travel time approximately 45 minutes depend on the road traffic. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: San Christobal; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antananarivo - Diego Suarez (Antsiranana): After breakfast you will travel to northern city of Diego Suarez. (Flight time 1:35-45 hrs) Upon arrival in Diego you will travel your hotel just 20 minutes away from the airport. Afternoon you will explore with your guide Diego Suarez. Diego Suarez is named after the two Portuguese explorers who discovered Madagascar. Diego Suarez also known as Antsiranana and it is situated in the north of Madagascar. It has one of the world's most beautiful deep-water harbours, complete with a photographic sugarloaf mountain. This is one of the most French cities in Madagascar. It has the colonial feel all over it with colonial style architecture such as former Governance Residence, Colbert Street, Regional office etc. This is the largest city of the north with a huge cosy market selling an abundance of fine local products and hand-made crafts, a range of restaurants. Location: - Diego; Hotel: Suarez Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Diego Suarez (Antsiranana) - Joffreville (Amber Mountain): After breakfast you will discover the Three Bays, Sugarloaf Mountain with 4x4 and the Battle of Madagascar sites. The sandy track will lead to series of all three bays with beautiful sceneries. Series of beautiful turquoise bays, lined with long white sandy beaches with interesting names such as the Pigeons’ Bay, the Duns’Bay, the Sakalava Bay. As you travel along you will see the artillery and fortifications, material evidence of Battle of Madagascar. This forgotten war is the last fought war between France and Britain. The British campaign called ‘Ironclad’ to capture the natural harbour of Diego Suarez and Madagascar during World War II. Afterwards visit the Ramena Beach to try some local dishes. Ramena is a picture postcard tropical beach with white sands and its turquoise blue sea. Afternoon you will travel to Amber Mountain National Park in Joffreville. Location: - Joffreville; Hotel: Nature Lodge; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Joffreville (Amber Mountain): Today you will explore the Amber Mountain National park. Amber Mountain is also known as Montagne d’Ambre and it is massif montane rainforest that rises from the surrounding dry region forming an isolated stretch of forest covering an area of 18, 200 hectares and lying at altitudes between 800 and 1.470 meters. The Amber Mountain National Park is home to 25 species of mammals, among them 6 carnivores such as the ring-tailed mongoose and the fossa, and 8 lemurs: Sanford's brown lemur, crowned lemur, lesser bamboo lemur and five species of nocturnal lemurs. Besides these forests are the home of 75 different bird species (35 of which are endemic and even locally endemic, like the Amber Mountainrock-thrush ), 60 reptiles, such as tiny stump-tailed chameleons, Brookesia the smallest chameleon in the world, leaf-tailed geckos and snakes, 35 frogs and more than 40 butterflies. The rich luxurious flora and fauna created unique three ecosystems (montane rainforest, mid-altitude rainforest and dry deciduous forests) give shelter to more than one thousand different plants. You will have guided walk with a local park guide to explore this great biodiversity sanctuary abundant of endemic fauna and flora, luxuriant vegetation, many waterfalls and volcanic lakes which honeycomb the area. The climate is perfect with cool air refreshes after the heat of the lowlands. The dominant ethnic groups are the Sakavala and the Antankarana. Location: - Joffreville; Hotel: Nature Lodge; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

7 Joffreville (Amber Mountain) - Ankarana National Park: Today after breakfast you will travel to Ankarana National Park en-route visiting the Red Tsingy. Red Tsingy is a miracle of nature in many ways to understand geology and erosion. The Red Tsingy is made of red laterite similar to clay and not of limestone rock like the Tsingy at Ankarana or Bemaraha. They are caused by heavy rain which is regular in these parts of Madagascar as well as the wind. As a result of erosion caused by the rain, wind and soft soil these imaginary and ravine of sharp, ancient rock formations unique to Madagascar. These turned out to be sand formations overlaid by red clay long ago. Erosion has worn the clay away, exposing the tall white (with tinges of red) columns of sand formations underneath. For those who've been to Bryce Canyon National Park, it's some ways similar as both of them formed by erosion. This fragile nature’s gift can disappear quickly. Please do not touch them. Afterwards continue your journey to Ankarana National Park. Location: - Ankarana; Hotel: Iharana Bush Camp; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ankarana National Park : Today you will discover the Ankarana National Park for a half day or full day depend on your fitness level. Ankarana National Park is an eroded limestone massif fortress with sharp ridges known as Tsingy. The forest is covered with patches of tropical jungle takes you through deep caves, deciduous forests and canyons. These canyons and caves are the biggest underground network of Africa and rushing with rivers. The Ankarana Reserve covering an area of 182,5 km² with spectacular views of karst topography, being its most known result the fantastically eroded limestone spires, known as “Tsingy”. The reserve contains one of the highest densities of primates of any forest in the world. Its dense forests support one of the largest and least disturbed populations of crowned lemurs. Sanford's brown lemur, perrier's black lemur, northern sportive lemur and dwarf lemurs, ring-tailed mongoose, fossa, tenrecs and Madagascar striped civet are also a common sight. Almost 100 bird species, 50 reptiles (including some endemic and threatened snakes and geckos) and 10 frogs cohabit in the Park. Inside the spectacular and huge labyrinth of caves 14 bat species, local endemic blind shrimps and the world's only known cave-living crocodiles. Location: - Ankarana; Hotel: Iharana Bush Camp; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

7 Joffreville (Amber Mountain) - Ankarana National Park: Today after breakfast you will travel to Ankarana National Park en-route visiting the Red Tsingy. Red Tsingy is a miracle of nature in many ways to understand geology and erosion. The Red Tsingy is made of red laterite similar to clay and not of limestone rock like the Tsingy at Ankarana or Bemaraha. They are caused by heavy rain which is regular in these parts of Madagascar as well as the wind. As a result of erosion caused by the rain, wind and soft soil these imaginary and ravine of sharp, ancient rock formations unique to Madagascar. These turned out to be sand formations overlaid by red clay long ago. Erosion has worn the clay away, exposing the tall white (with tinges of red) columns of sand formations underneath. For those who've been to Bryce Canyon National Park, it's some ways similar as both of them formed by erosion. This fragile nature’s gift can disappear quickly. Please do not touch them. Afterwards continue your journey to Ankarana National Park. Location: - Ankarana; Hotel: Ankarana Lodge; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ankarana National Park - Nosy Be Isaland: You will travel Ankify near Nosy Be Island. Travel time approximately 4-5 hours. En-route you will visit a spice plantation to discover the spices including Madagascar Vanilla. Vanilla plant is an orchid and has been successfully cultivated in Madagascar for almost one century. Although the plant originally comes from Central America, Madagascar is the biggest exporter of Vanilla worldwide today. You may wish to buy some to take home. From Ankify you will be transferred to Nosy Be by boat. Location: - Nosy Be; Hotel: Vanilla Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Nosy Be - Constance Tsarabanjina (Nosy Mitsio): From Nosy Be Island, you will take a boat to your next destination, you will travel to the beautiful Island of Constance Tsarabanjina where you will be enjoying four days of relaxation of beach, sun and sea. Travel time lasts approximately one hour. You will be discovering the unspoiled Island of Tsarabanjina surrounded by blue azure water and sandy golden beaches where you will be enjoying walking barefoot. Full days at leisure or explore nearby islands. Diving or snorkeling can be arranged with the hotel to explore the unique biodiversity of the Island. Location: - Nosy Mitsio; Hotel: Constance Tsarabanjina; Board: Breakfast; Lunch & Dinner

Constance Tsarabanjina (Nosy Mitsio): Full days at leisure or explore nearby islands. Diving or snorkeling can be arranged with the hotel to explore the unique biodiversity of the Island. Location: - Nosy Mitsio; Hotel: Constance Tsarabanjina; Board: Breakfast; Lunch & Dinner

Constance Tsarabanjina (Nosy Mitsio): Full days at leisure or explore nearby islands. Diving or snorkeling can be arranged with the hotel to explore the unique biodiversity of the Island. Location: - Nosy Mitsio; Hotel: Constance Tsarabanjina; Board: Breakfast; Lunch & Dinner
